title: Patch Tuesday: Microsoft (Finally) Patches Exploited Office Zero-Days
description:
Patch Tuesday: A month after confirming active exploitation of Office code execution flaws, Microsoft has shipped patches for multiple affected products.

The post Patch Tuesday: Microsoft (Finally) Patches Exploited Office Zero-Days appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Patch Tuesday: Adobe Patches 30 Acrobat, Reader Vulns
description:
Adobe rolls out a big batch of security updates to fix at least 30 Acrobat and Reader vulnerabilities affecting Windows and macOS users.

The post Patch Tuesday: Adobe Patches 30 Acrobat, Reader Vulns appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: White House Holds First-Ever Summit on the Ransomware Crisis Plaguing the Nation’s Public Schools
description:
CISA will step up training for the K-12 sector and technology providers, including Amazon Web Services and Cloudflare, will offer grants and free software.

The post White House Holds First-Ever Summit on the Ransomware Crisis Plaguing the Nation’s Public Schools appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Horizon3 AI Raises $40 Million to Expand Automated Pentesting Platform
description:
Horizon3.ai, a provider of autonomous security testing solutions, raised $40 million through a Series C funding round.

The post Horizon3 AI Raises $40 Million to Expand Automated Pentesting Platform appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Protection is No Longer Straightforward – Why More Cybersecurity Solutions Must Incorporate Context
description:
Context helps complete the picture and results in actionable intelligence that security teams can use to make informed decisions more quickly.

The post Protection is No Longer Straightforward – Why More Cybersecurity Solutions Must Incorporate Context appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Identity-Based Attacks Soared in Past Year: Report
description:
Identity-based attacks have soared in the past year, according to CrowdStrike’s 2023 Threat Hunting Report.

The post Identity-Based Attacks Soared in Past Year: Report appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: ICS Patch Tuesday: Siemens Fixes 7 Vulnerabilities in Ruggedcom Products
description:
ICS Patch Tuesday: Siemens releases a dozen advisories covering over 30 vulnerabilities, but Schneider Electric has only published one advisory.

The post ICS Patch Tuesday: Siemens Fixes 7 Vulnerabilities in Ruggedcom Products appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: UK Think Tank Proposes Greater Ransomware Reporting From Cyberinsurance to Government
description:
The Royal United Services Institute (RUSI) examined the relationship between cyberinsurance and ransomware, and proposes greater reporting from victims to government, enforced through insurance policies.

The post UK Think Tank Proposes Greater Ransomware Reporting From Cyberinsurance to Government appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Black Hat Preview: The Business of Cyber Takes Center Stage
description:
The cybersecurity industry heads to Las Vegas this week for Black Hat in a state of economic contraction, confusion and excitement. Can the promise of AI overcome the hype cycle to truly solve security problems?

The post Black Hat Preview: The Business of Cyber Takes Center Stage appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Microsoft Shares Guidance and Resources for AI Red Teams
description:
Microsoft has shared guidance and resources from its AI Red Team program to help organizations and individuals with AI security.

The post Microsoft Shares Guidance and Resources for AI Red Teams appeared first on SecurityWeek.
